intro: Cephalorrhynchus talyschensis, commonly known as the Talyschensky cephalorrhynchus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features include a short stem, aromatic foliage, and an unusual floral structure that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
